name: pearpass-app-desktop
readme_summary: PearPass is a desktop application for secure password management, offering encrypted storage for credentials and notes. It synchronizes data across devices and provides offline access, along with features like password generation and strength analysis.
key_features: Secure password, identity, credit card, notes, and custom fields storage
primary_use_case: Securely managing and synchronizing passwords and sensitive information across multiple devices.
cover_image_prompt: A highly organized, futuristic vault door with multiple glowing keyholes, each representing a different device (laptop, tablet, phone). A central, secure 'key' object, subtly shaped like the PearPass logo, is being inserted into the main lock. As the key turns, streams of encrypted data flow securely from the vault to each device's keyhole, depicted as glowing, protected conduits. The scene is set in a clean, modern digital space with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing security and seamless connectivity. Small, abstract UI elements representing password strength meters and a random generator icon are subtly integrated into the background. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a cool, professional color palette.

name: SmolDocling-OCR-App
description: SmolDocling OCR App built using SmolDocling 256M Model and Streamlit.
readme_summary: SmolDocling OCR App is a Streamlit-based application that utilizes the SmolDocling 256M model to perform advanced Optical Character Recognition on document images. It extracts text and structured data, supporting various document types and outputting results in DocTags and Markdown formats.
key_features: Specialized Document Processing (tables, code, formulas, charts, sections)
primary_use_case: Extracting text and structured data from various document images using advanced OCR capabilities.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously scanning ancient scrolls with a futuristic, glowing magnifying glass. The magnifying glass projects streams of organized text and data onto a nearby digital tablet, which displays neatly formatted documents and charts. The scrolls represent diverse document types like tables, code, and mathematical formulas. Subtle holographic interfaces and glowing data particles surround the scene, hinting at the underlying AI technology. The background is a cozy, modern library with soft lighting. The composition is focused on the librarian and the transformation of analog information into digital structure. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear iconography and a warm color palette.

name: datatui
readme_summary: DataTUI is a fast, keyboard-first terminal UI application built with Rust for exploring and manipulating data. It supports various file formats like CSV, Excel, and SQLite, offering features such as tabbed views, sorting, filtering, and SQL querying via Polars.
key_features: Tabbed data views with quick navigation
CSV/TSV, Excel, and SQLite import flows
Polarsâ€‘backed SQL queries and lazy evaluation
Find, Find All, and value viewer
primary_use_case: Exploring and manipulating data directly within the terminal environment using a keyboard-first interface.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled cartographer in a cozy, dimly lit study, meticulously drawing a detailed map on a large parchment. Instead of traditional ink, the cartographer uses a glowing stylus that pulls streams of data from various sources (represented by small, stylized icons of spreadsheets, databases, and text files) and weaves them into the map's intricate pathways and labels. The map itself is a complex, interactive visualization of interconnected data points. Subtle UI elements resembling a terminal window are visible on a nearby desk, displaying the cartographer's commands. The overall mood is one of focused exploration and discovery, rendered in a rich digital painting style with clear outlines and a warm, inviting color palette.

name: TLDR_Terms
description: Use AI to instantly summarize websites' terms of service and highlight any concerning elements
readme_summary: TLDR Terms is a Chrome extension that uses AI to summarize website terms of service documents and highlight potentially concerning clauses. It aims to make legal agreements more accessible and understandable for users.
key_features: Automatically detects terms of service pages
Summarizes terms of service using AI
Allows clicking summary items to scroll to relevant sections
primary_use_case: To provide users with quick, understandable summaries of website terms of service, identifying potential risks or unfavorable clauses.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old owl wearing spectacles, perched on a stack of legal documents. The owl is holding a magnifying glass that illuminates key phrases and warnings within the documents, transforming dense text into simple, digestible icons. Around the owl, subtle digital particles and a small, glowing screen displaying the 'TLDR Terms' logo suggest its AI-powered nature. The scene is set in a cozy, well-lit library, conveying trust and clarity. The overall composition is clean and focused, emphasizing the owl's role as a guide through complex information. Rendered in a warm, inviting 3D isometric illustration style with soft lighting and a color palette of blues, greens, and parchment tones.

name: querity
description: Open-source Java query builder for SQL and NoSQL
readme_summary: Querity is an extensible Java query builder designed to simplify the creation and execution of database queries across both SQL and NoSQL databases. It offers a unified language for complex query operations like filtering, sorting, and pagination, with modular support for various database technologies.
key_features: Extensible query builder for SQL and NoSQL
Modular support for JPA, MongoDB, Elasticsearch
Support for REST APIs and DTO layer
Single language for all database types
primary_use_case: To provide a unified and simplified way for Java developers to build and execute complex database queries across different SQL and NoSQL data stores using a single, consistent language.
cover_image_prompt: A master cartographer in a bustling medieval workshop, meticulously drawing a single, unified map that seamlessly blends different terrains: a serene lake (representing SQL), a dense jungle (representing NoSQL MongoDB), and a fiery volcano (representing NoSQL Elasticsearch). The cartographer uses a magical quill that draws lines of code and data streams, transforming raw parchment (input) into beautifully detailed map sections (output). Small, glowing UI elements resembling query builders float around the workshop, and the repository name 'Querity' is subtly etched onto the cartographer's magnifying glass. The scene is rendered in a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration style with warm, inviting lighting, emphasizing clarity and interconnectedness.

name: ViewPoint
description: A Math expression parser and evaluator with support of runtime data-type checking written in native JS.
readme_summary: ViewPoint is a native JavaScript library for parsing and evaluating mathematical expressions. It supports various data types, including numbers, BigInt, strings, and booleans, and includes robust data-type checking to prevent errors during evaluation. The library also offers features like expression tokenization, infix to postfix conversion, and support for JavaScript and external variables.
key_features: Handles nested expressions with multiple levels of nesting
Supports multiple data types (decimal, BigInt, String, Boolean)
Tokenizes expressions into an array of tokens
Converts infix expressions to postfix notation
Follows PEMDAS order of operations by default
primary_use_case: Evaluating mathematical expressions from strings in JavaScript applications, with built-in data type validation and flexibility for custom operations.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled alchemist in a dimly lit, ancient laboratory, meticulously pouring different colored liquids (representing various data types like numbers, strings, booleans) from vials into a complex, glowing alembic. The alembic is actively transforming these inputs into a single, pure, golden liquid that flows into a crystal beaker labeled 'ViewPoint'. Subtle digital particles emanate from the alembic, and a small, holographic display nearby shows the mathematical formula being processed. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style, with rich textures and a mystical, focused atmosphere, emphasizing the transformation and validation process.
